poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Why glance at me in a stranger Through the glass, the greener grass? It grants you a keener self; It grafts an actionable desire on nothing much. Nothing much: graphs superimposed on graphs That somehow grasps that's all it is And gasps at pain and pleasure. Here you are. Gaps in awareness coin the individual, Random facts - they don't gas fish in China, Etcaetera - clownish gaffes in company That gaffs you with a spike when you don't watch it. Hurricanes are cloisters where powers meditate. The eyes are cloistergarths, where wells reflect.
